content.description:
Climb the chimney in the left facing corner, left of

A Nice Pair

.
content.protection: Standard Rack and pick what you need.

climbs.name: I Touch The Future
climbs.fa: Jodee Janda, Greg Rzonca, Gordon Barnett, and Alan Bartlett, January 1993

content.description: This is a strongly overhanging dihedral with finger and hand jams. It's lots of fun, although the crack isnt solid enough for gear. This route is not in the 1992 Vogel Guide.
content.protection: Standard rack.  (The rock is so bad along the crack that you shouldn't expect gear to hold.  Consider yourself free-soloing, with an awful landing.)
content.location:
About 200 yards northeast of the

Hershey Kiss

is an obvious overhanging right-facing corner on dark rock, about 80' above the desert floor.  Route gets sun till ~ 2 PM in early March.

climbs.name: Ghost on the Road
climbs.fa: Chris Miller and George Armstrong, January 1993

content.description: Climb unprotected slab to reach a crack system that starts about halfway up the face.
content.location:
Located 300 meters southeast from

A Nice Pair

on the north face of a large formation near a wash.

content.description: Climbs a nice squeeze chimney to hand crack with good quality rock.
content.location:
Located directly behind the block housing

A Nice Pair

and 50 feet left of

Rain Dogs

.

climbs.name: Bright Moments
climbs.fa: Lavon Weighall and Chuck Davis, October 1988

content.description: Climbs a vertical dike system which bifurcates partway up the face. Gear belay and scramble off.
content.protection: 2 bolts, gear to 3 inches for anchors
content.location:
Located on a southeast facing wall north of, or behind,

A Nice Pair

.

climbs.name: A Nice Pair
climbs.fa: Lavon Weighall and Chuck Davis, October 1988

content.description:
This climbs The outside face of The pointed Boulder on the ledge, right of "I Touch The Future".

From the ledge on the right side of  the boulder, climb up and left, then up, past three bolts.
